Where do I even begin? how awesome is it that so many here started "HOME" during lockdown when in fact it was filmed before Covid-19 went rampant?
I started a few months ago, decided to begin at the beginning (30 day yoga camp from 2015), and have followed all the 30 day sequels since, without skipping a day. Yes, Adriene is magic and this is just too good to miss. I thank you all for this. This beautiful community, the footnotes, the sharing.
So today I share.
Went through a colonoscopy yesterday, and doing the preparation and cleansing, stuff came up. I took the opportunity the clear up the emotional baggage I had been carrying (like many of us, I grew up in with a lot of abuse. used to carry the stress in my belly). So today as my belly kept rumbling and everything felt like it was moving around rearranging itself, I knew I wanted to go down deep and break that 'spell' (Brain Ridgeway, another great recommendation from one of the talkbacks here) . It was time to stop feeling unloved, unworthy. and Adriene's words reached out to me like so many loving hands - "practice softening in hard times... activate your breath - and let it do the work for you" and so I did. with sukha. I let the breathe carry me. Here is was I received, and I share it with all of you:

You were always loved.
It is safe to be loved.
You never deserved that sh*t.
They never did it to hurt you
You are already forgiven

I took it in.
I sent it out.

And when I came out of it, blessed and filled with gratitude, I realized something else. The word Deserve was always there, always carried great weight, ominously. that I was underserving of love. I flipped it a couple of times and understood part of it was sadness, and another part of it was anger because I sure didn't deserve the way I had been treated either. And then finally something else dawned on me. Its not about deserving at all. I don't need to earn being loved. It is not a reward for good service.

May we all love ourselves and other, with kindness and an open heart.
Namaste

This may sound sappy, but here it goes. This is my lil' Canadian yoga story.

I started doing yoga with Adriene in early August, so this is my second 30 Days challenge with her. I started because my 27th birthday was at the end of July and upon seeing a picture of myself, on my birthday, sitting in a lake and enjoying myself, I burst out crying. COVID-19 has been hard on all, myself included, and seemingly every summer I do get body image issues more so than the rest of the year and this summer was particular bad due to the added stresses of Miss Rona.
So in retaliation, I bought myself new walking/running shoes, a yoga mat, and yoga block.
Now this marks my 35th, or so, day of yoga and I'm also walking a few kilometres everyday.
I'm not overweight, (27F, 5'9") a bit chubbier than what I would like and I know that I want to tone my muscles more. My weight, per se, has not changed, though my goal to start would be to lose 15 lbs. I know that it's not good to focus on the numbers, for as I lose fat and gain muscle, the numbers won't necessarily go down.
All in all... I've noticed how much my flexibility has improved, for instance: now I'm able to do positions that before made my arms shake. These days, I WANT to do yoga, I WANT to go for my walk. Routine and habit achieved!
Today, as Adriene was near the end of this video and was saying to inhale and "lift" yourself, whatever that might mean, I admit that I started to cry. NOT sad tears, but HAPPY tears!
I feel great! Sure I'm not at my ideal weight and sure, my thighs are bigger than what I'd like, my belly has a bit more pudge than what I prefer, but I feel great! I have an incredibly, loving, and supportive boyfriend, we're moving to Niagara Falls next month, I'm a Masters student at Western University, and okay, the world might be on fire, but I feel fine!
I can't wait util I'm able to say, "Oh I've been doing yoga nearly every day for [3 months]/[6 months]/[A YEAR!!]"
